results.headline: Love, Sex, Desire and Lyrics (Oh, and Stiletto Pumps) Across the Decades

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Beloved

results.summary_short: The French director Christophe Honoré laces “Beloved,” a musical film starring Catherine Deneuve and Chiara Mastroianni, with whimsy and loss.

results.headline: Walking, Talking, Leafy Young Boy Sprouts From a Box of Wishes
results.display_title: The Odd Life of Timothy Green

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Odd Life of Timothy Green

results.summary_short: “The Odd Life of Timothy Green” features a little boy, of sorts, who by his magical, guileless presence manages to make everybody nicer.

results.headline: For a Zealous Cop and a Gang of Two-Bit Thieves, Crime Does Not Pay

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Max et les Ferrailleurs

results.summary_short: Released in France in 1971, “Max et les Ferrailleurs,” by Claude Sautet, is receiving a belated American opening in the Film Society of Lincoln Center’s retrospective of his work.

results.headline: Deal Making in Hong Kong, Distracted by Debauchery

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Supercapitalist

results.summary_short: The dollar-driven drama “$upercapitalist” focuses on an uncannily prescient Asian-American hedge fund trader dispatched to Hong Kong to oversee a hostile takeover.

results.headline: Kiss Babies, Dodge Scandal, Praise the Lord

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Campaign

results.summary_short: “The Campaign,” starring Will Ferrell and Zach Galifianakis, is a fun-house fable about the absurdities of our democracy in this contentious election year.

results.headline: Bourne, Under New Management

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Bourne Legacy

results.summary_short: The fourth installment in this franchise is less a thrilling reboot than a salvage mission, with Jeremy Renner taking over from Matt Damon.

results.headline: The Two Halves of a Neighborhood’s Soul, Bared for All to See

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Red Hook Summer

results.summary_short: “Red Hook Summer,” directed by Spike Lee, looks at African-American resilience in a struggling New York City neighborhood.

results.headline: 3 Guests, 48 Hours, Constant Agita

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 2 Days in New York

results.summary_short: Julie Delpy’s “2 Days in New York,” about a chaotic period in a woman’s life, uses charm and insight to explore ideas about romance and cultural misunderstanding.

results.headline: Theodor Herzl, a Life From Journalism to Zionism
results.display_title: It's No Dream: The Life of Theodor Herzl

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of It's No Dream: The Life of Theodor Herzl

results.summary_short: “It Is No Dream” sticks closely to the biography of Theodor Herzl and his pursuit of a Jewish state, using still photos and early film footage.

results.headline: Hard to Have Dreams if Mom’s a Nightmare

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Goats

results.summary_short: “Goats,” directed by Christopher Neil, is a modern-day coming-of-age story.

results.headline: Trapped in a Jungle and a State of Mind

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Almayer's Folly

results.summary_short: “Almayer’s Folly,” a tropical study in helpless intransigence, adapted from Conrad’s often-overlooked debut novel.

results.headline: Still Together, in Separate Beds

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hope Springs

results.summary_short: “Hope Springs” brings Meryl Streep and Tommy Lee Jones together as a couple in a longtime marriage that’s gone dry. Enter a therapist, Steve Carell.

results.headline: Twin Prostitutes, Growing Old Plying Their Trade in Amsterdam

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Meet the Fokkens

results.summary_short: “Meet the Fokkens” is a documentary about 69-year-old identical twins who have lived and worked as prostitutes in Amsterdam’s red-light district for over 50 years.

results.headline: Three Friends’ Approaches to Martial Law

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Girlfriend Boyfriend - GF BF

results.summary_short: Three childhood friends brush with the history of Taiwan in “Girlfriend Boyfriend.”

results.headline: Rob What Kind of Bank?

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Babymakers

results.summary_short: “The Babymakers,” a raunchy heist comedy directed by Jay Chandrasekhar, features Olivia Munn and Paul Schneider as a young couple who have trouble conceiving.

results.headline: One Item on the World Menu Has Its Critics

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sushi: The Global Catch

results.summary_short: A documentary examines the popularity of sushi and questions its sustainability.

results.headline: Even in the Future, It’s Not Paranoia if They’re Out to Get You

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Total Recall

results.summary_short: In “Total Recall,” inspired by a Philip K. Dick story, Colin Farrell plays a futuristic factory worker who is haunted by strange dreams.

results.headline: Bravado and Caresses: Girls on the Way to Life

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mosquita y Mari

results.summary_short: “Mosquita y Mari,” written and directed by Aurora Guerrero, is the story of the fraught friendship between two 15-year-old girls in Los Angeles.

results.headline: Love Letter to Pioneers of Avant-Garde Moviemaking
results.display_title: Free Radicals: A History of Experimental Film

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Free Radicals: A History of Experimental Film

results.summary_short: In “Free Radicals: A History of Experimental Film,” Pip Chodorov offers an enthusiastic, accessible look at the genre’s big names.

results.headline: Lost to Her Friends, but There All the Time

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dreams of A Life

results.summary_short: The documentary “Dreams of a Life” explores the life and death, at 38, of the singer Joyce Vincent.
